metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4585 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 116, Firefox ESR 115.1, and Thunderbird 115.1. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 117, Firefox ESR < 115.2, and Thunderbird < 115.2.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
